author: arnetheduck
content: <@144468805697929216> if you want to make a correct request, `head_block_root` has to be a block that's not yet been finalized by the responding client - a safe bet is to use the head block root reported by the client in the `Status` message, and rerequest `Status` periodically (ie after an epoch of wall-clock time has passed)

author: arnetheduck
content: wall-clock, because finalization lags behind head by ~3 epochs, so if you receive a status message, the block root will remain valid for requests for that much time, but you want some safety margin to account for travel time and.. throttling ðŸ™‚
